text: Exercise 1* 1. v1: (plus) 3 -> 3, 12 -> 12 (par) 3+12 →Aexp v1 = 15 (3 + 12 ) →Aexp v1 = 15 v2: (mult) 5 -> 5, 8 -> 8 (par) 5 * 8 →Aexp 5*8 (mult) 4 -> 4 , ( 5 * 8 )→Aexp 4*40 (par) 4 *(5 * 8 )→Aexp 160 (4 *(5 * 8 ))→Aexp 160 (mult) (3 + 12 ) →Aexp v1, (4 *(5 * 8 ))→Aexp v2 (3 + 12 )*(4 *(5 * 8 )) →Aexp v1v2 = 2400 2, 3. Exercise 2 We modify the rules from the slides We modify the rule ⋆ − 2ss, to replace a1 with v1. a2 ⇒Aexp a′ 2 v1 ⋆ a2 ⇒Aexp v1 ⋆ a′ 2 This means that we always evaluate left-to-right. Exercise 3* a1 →Aexp v1 a2 →Aexp v2 a1 = a2 →Bexp tt where v1 = v2 a1 →Aexp v1 a2 →Aexp v2 a1 = a2 →Bexp ff where v1 ≠ v2 Same thing for < b1 →Bexp tt ¬b1 → ff Same for false b1 →Bexp tt b2 →Bexp tt b1 ∧ b2 → tt bi →Bexp ff b1 ∧ b2 → ff where i ∈ {1, 2}
